newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore gas oil softer on weaker IPE prices.
newsitem.headline: Singapore gas oil softer on weaker IPE prices.

text.p: Singapore oil products were mixed on Monday amid crude falls with gas oil weaker following a sharp fall in gas oil futures on London's IPE, traders said.

Gas oil swaps had earlier rose on news that India bought 720,000 tonnes of diesel in 17 cargoes in its tender for February delivery. India's purchase was within market expectations and much higher than its previous monthly purchases since October.
Physical gas oil was offered lower at $32.45 a barrel for 30,000 tonnes lifting January 9-13 fob. Gas oil was offered 20 cents more on Friday.
Jet fuel was also bid lower at $32.50 for January 18-22 lifting fob, compared with an offer on Friday at $33.

Vietnam has issued its tender to buy various oil products for first quarter 1997 delivery. The tender which closes on December 27, seeks 256,000 tonnes of gas oil and jet-kerosene fuel, 189,000 tonnes of 170-cst fuel oil and 153,000 tonnes of 83-octane leaded gasoline.

A major dropped its offer for 150,000 barrels of LSWR from $22.75 to $22.30 over Singapore quotes fob, lifting early Jan. Indonesia is expected to make its January allocation this week but traders projected firm north Asian demand to boost prices.

Japanese demand is projected at 1.6 million barrels while South Korea requires 1.5 million barrels. Premiums for cracked LSWR were assessed around $1.00 over Singapore quotes and straight-run at $1.50. High sulphur 180-cst fuel oil was bid by a Singapore trader and offered by a Dutch trader at $124 a tonne for different timings of January 10-14 and 18-22, respectively.

Gasoline and naphtha eased with crude in dull trading while Japan is on holiday. Taiwan emerged to buy 250,000 barrels of each leaded and unleaded 95-octane reformate for delivery late Jan-Feb in a tender which closes December 30.
